title: Access Denied
content:
Previously all of the email accounts created in thunderbird worked flawlessly, one day when checking email automatically a seperate window opened displaying the error "Access Denied", I searched the net for a solution and could not find one, it is very possible that one of the most recent linux updates may have changed something as I recall a larger than normal update just before this occurred a few days ago.

Thank you.

Access Denied You don't have permission to access "http://login.xfinity.com/login" on this server.

Reference #18.952b1eb8.1726386894.6b0a37f

https://errors.edgesuite.net/18.952b1eb8.1726386894.6b0a37f

title: Thunderbird and Microsoft Exchange server 2019 phantom folder imap protocol
content:
I am using microsoft Exchange 2019 CU13 Nov23SU I use Thunderbird mailbox client Version 128.2.0esr | Released September 4, 2024 OS server 2019 server 1809 17763.6189


I use the imap protocol.

And during folder transfer, deletion or renaming, phantom folders are created. If I install this mailbox on another computer, the phantom folders are loaded.

There are no such problems with Outlook. Can anyone tell me what to do about this? (if i use protocol mapi) In web mail i too not see fhantom folder

title: Missing folders etc after xubuntu upgrade  to 22.04
content:
I have just upgraded xubuntu to 24.04, and am now missing all folders. Messages are available on searching, so all is not lost. Can send and receive OK. I suspect "snap". Looking at my file map, I see that I have Tbird and snap at the same level, and also "Thunderbird_backup_profile.zip".

A user with snap-related problems on here was advised thus:

"UDP: Remove thunderbird in snap. Install over apt. All works perfect. DO NOT USE install thunderbird in snap!"

OK, so what can I do now, please?

Roy

title: Gmail messages not appearing in folder structure on Thunderbird
content:
Hi there,

I recently set up Thunderbird to access my Gmail using IMAP. All seems well, except for the fact that some messages have gone missing from their folders/labels. For example - I have a message thread in Gmail, labelled 'Work', with the subject line 'New project'. As expected, these have appeared as a folder in Thunderbird called 'Work', and a message thread with the subject line 'New project'. But not all the messages in the Gmail conversation are there. It's pretty extreme, too - the conversation on the Gmail website has 10 messages in it, and on Thunderbird only two are showing. So, I did a search for text in the missing messages, and they showed up in my my 'All Mail' folder - but I need them to appear as part of the conversation. Any advice? This is going to be a bit of a nightmare for email organisation if I can't get it sorted.
creator: teaandowls

title: lost emails
content: For security reasons my computer has had to be re formated. As all my sent emails are listed is it possible to recover my received emails over the same time period.

title: Když odešlu mail na kontakt *volný.cz, tak mail nedorazí a ani se mi nevrátí
content: tučně Dobrý den, prosím o radu Když odešlu mail na adresu *volný.cz, tak se nedoručí a ani se mi nevrátí. Ale z této konkrétní adresy mi mail dorazí. Nevím, zda mám problém hledat u sebe nebo má problém příjemce mailu. Problém je pouze u jednoho kontaktu, i když kontaktů s adresou *volný.cz mám víc, tam problém není Děkuji za odpověď a přeju příjemný den Hofhanzlová tel. 725 646 418
creator: vlad.ho

title: Missing mails and folder settings after Ubuntu update
content:
Hi, I updated Ubuntu and after update almost all my emails and my catalogues settings are gone. I only see a few mails received over the past 2 weeks before an update, and a few from a few weeks after I bought my PC and set up Thunderbird.

During the update I was asked: "Do you want to reset your setting to default?" and some second question and I responded "Yes" twice.

Everything apart from mails from Thunderbird stayed with no changes. Do you have any idea how to try to get my mails back? I'm happy to share all data you need to answer my question. Thank you in advance!
creator: anwac
